Must select each individual ship to set target.  And for some reason my flagship will move in the opposite direction as to where I want it to go.  Annoying staticy sound effects.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

“The Fleets of Sol” is an action-filled RTS/RTT set of course in some far flung galaxy, a long, long time ago (perhaps). From what was initially an interesting take on “BSG”’s episode “33” (the first episode of Season One), where you must enter a sector of space and rescue transports and/or engage enemy supply stations/fleets. The player has 90 seconds before the FTL drives spool up and in that time the player has to survive what can be an onslaught of enemy craft. Survive that, attend your fleet and jump. But don’t leave it too long to jump, as more enemies are on their way.
As I said, ‘initially’ this was about it. The Devs aren’t happy to sit on their laurels, though and the game has grown, and keeps growing with asteroid fields to contend with, attacks on your home base to defend against and now commanders and pilot attributes added. Next, full-fledged missions are being implemented. With each patch/build, and they are fast and furiously with these, the Devs not only welcome feedback but actively seek it, so much so that the game feels very much like a community-driven project. And the game just keeps improving as a result. The graphics, using the Unreal 3 Engine can look ark and a little ‘muddy’ at times, but even these are being constantly tweaked and addressed. I don’t remember even “Homeworld” receiving this much love when it first came out, and many gamers caved on that title as the difficulty wore on many gamers. There are challenges with this title too, bugs at first, but now an efficient and often tricky A.I. There have been hurdles yes, but as the game keeps growing these are dealt with leading this very long time gamer actually excited to see what is coming next. As it is, the game is very playable and filled with enough content to have you coming back for more…just one more jump. You can research new ship designs, improvements to your current fleet and special abilities.
As a fleet-based RTT (more so than an RTS) I haven’t found anything quite like it and for the asking price…..do yourself a favour and just buy it. You will not be disappointed.

reviewText:
Sadly there is no maybe or tentative option to these things, only yes or no. With that in mind I say Yes but with reservations.

Having played around with this a little while I always keep coming back to the idea that this is a tablet game. Maybe it actually it is, maybe it isn't, honestly didn't care enough to look that up.

The game looks decent enough but controls like.. [Insert appropriate metaphor here]. Not hotkeys than I can find for ship selection, clicking in the list focuses the camera when I don't want it to, trying to find an individual ship to select to activate any special abilities in the middle of a cluster♥♥♥♥ is next to impossible, especially smaller ships.

A huge opportunity for something amazing was missed here, the description gives the impression of some vast universe and everyone in it is out to get you. Not true, you jump from small arena box to small arena box with no choice except Unknown or Homebase (Probes and research eventually open this to 3 choices or home). Still just little arena boxes though.

Everything always starts off within shooting range, no time to really move your fleet, no need/use for any form of tactical play, launch fighters, set weapon power to max, fight with a bad UI to click ships and launch missile/plasma/whatever abilities. (The arena boxes and this bit are why this feels so much like a tablet game).

All that said though, when this game is on sale for a few bucks it may still be worth your time. You probably won't fall in love with it, it won't be something you'll brag to your friends about and I highly doubt you'll still be playing this in 6 months time, yet you may get a few decent hours out of it.

TL:DR: A tentative recommendation at a hefty discount, tablet style game/UI that could potentially pass a few hours.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nTo start positive: I love the concept. As a fan of BSG, and especially the tension of 33"
date: I'm happy this game is here. That said
hoursPlayed: it's very clear it's still in Alpha. Tooltips say things like "We can put text here in a smaller font". Ships have command buttons (like fire turrets/fire missiles) which are duplicated in x & y axis
voteText: and yet pushing on either of them does nothing. Which is the basic problem it has as things stand
helpfulPercent: the only button which obviously does anything is 'jump'. That does jump you to a new sector. But when you get there
votesHelpful: there may or may not be friendly ships there. If there are
votesTotal: there's no obvious way to tell (if you hang in battle for a while
votesFunny: you may suddenly read '1611 civilians killed'). The first couple of systems
column18: then.... there's no running count of how many you have
column19: how many you need. When you jump to a new sector
column21: either that you have to search a certain number
column22: or travel a certain distance (as you're always 1 jump from Home Base). There's no obvious way to tell ships to fire on other ships (whilst you can left click on your ships to get their name/health
column23: and left click enemy ships to see likewise
column24: does left clicking yours then left clicking theres order targetting? Or
column26: is it meant to? As it doesn't appear to.) Rather than the normal convention of middle wheel zooming
column27: middle wheel switches between your ships. Not sure if zooming is possible
column28: or if that's what's meant to happen when you push mouse to top of screen. If you jump to a supply depot
column29: and destroy all the enemy... did destroying the ships get you the supplies the system had? There seems no way to take the fuel & metal on board. I don't know if it was supposed to happen automatically in battle
column30: if a 'get resources' system is to be implemented later
column33: I'm rather bemused. The concept is great
column35: the interface is horrible. Who knows what's going to be changed & fixed as development goes on - I'm not unhappy I bought it to support further development
column36: but I can't imagine I'll be playing it again until there have been a lot of updates."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI can now recommend this game based on the updates that have been released.  At $8 I hardly see any reason not to pick it up if you like this sort of game.  i like the idea of battlestar galactica scenerio of rescuing other ships and then jumping away before re-enforcements can come.  The graphics are also nice for this type of game and it does seem like it is only going to get better.  I wouldn't mind seeing a story element added even it is a seperate purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game and is great fun to play for many reasons some I will list below:

1. Many different events to keep you intrested.
2. Challanging Enermy AI (the enermy is not stupid).
3. Also a good Allied AI that uses abillities as well.
4. Research is at a steady pace and well balances.
5. You ships weapons only target the correct ships there designed to kill, such as your large weapons on your command ship will only target large enermy ships and not waste time trying to hit fighters etc.
6. Each ship has well balanced skills and stats why still making it that you are not over powered
7. Regular updates that add new content to the game.
8. A Developer that listenings to the players and is in constant contant.
9. Realistic, which makes this game great, for example you may come across transport carrying civilians that you may want to try and rescue but you might finid yourself out numbered and forced to make a decision, risk trying to save them all or put the safetly of your fleet first.
10. No risk, no gain, sometimes you have to take risks to get good rewards, such as answering a destress call, sometimes it could mean new friends or sometimes it could be a trap to lure you in.

All together these 10 points and more in my opinion make this game great and I am happy to support it 100% of the way :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a game that reminds me a lot like Battlestar Galactica, where you get to command the fleet yourself. While in early access, the game has a lot of nice features, which I recommend you try out for yourself. Bear in mind that currently the game engine falters late-game, and too many ships on screen may crash your game. Hopefully this gets fixed later on.

My game was about to kill itself.I chose not to go back to my base because my computer would crash.Well...being myself I went back to my base when there was 50000 freighters on accident......................When I came to reality and saw how many freighters I had my mind went blank. It's game breaking glitches like these that need to be fixed ASAP.The only reason I am going to reccomend this or give it a thumbs up is because it has so much potential for it to be a good game

The game has good graphics, quite a few features, and many other things!! i will make my updated review later when i learn the game and as it grows more! Oh and Yay. im the first to write a review!

UPDATE: This is the actuall review.
the Fleets of Sol is good in many ways.
Pros:
-random events
-ship upgrades
-special abilities
-limitless potential
-amazing graphis
-very cool combat
-awesome laser effects
-great explosions
and the list goes on and on. There are many other things good aboout this game in terms of combat, controls, etc. but the main thing is all the potential it has and the fact that it is only $7.99 USD. Better buy it early considering it will DEFENITLY increase in pirce as it develops!
There really is nothing bad about this game but it could have a little more depth and a some more features with ships and all that. but do Remember that teh game was not released to long ago! Good luck with development guys and i cant wait for the further months to come!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game does not feel finished enough to be an early access game. I own many EA games but never any that felt this unfinished. There is literally about 20mins of play before a crash will decide for you that you've done everything that could be done so far in the game. Maybe there is a lot of potential here yes, but I think that it is too far away to warrant purchase of this game.

Even from a company standpoint, was releasing this game so early worth getting negative reviews? You can't tell me that this game is more than a free to play browser game of the sorts at this point. Take ideas" like this to kickstarter or something until you have a more finished product!.

Maybe in 6 months this game will actually have some content and I will update this review. Until then don't bother wasting your money on a game that only gives 20mins of playtime and may never be fully released."

reviewText:
Great idea but very poorly executed - I feel robbed!

Battle Camera is broken in many ways and doesn't respond to you.
Some missions are broken and doesn't work.
HUD & Interface is horrible. If you have a fleet of more then 10 ships it is almost impossible to pick the one you want. Sometimes the graphics on certain ships disappear after a sector jump.
Battles are very very very repetitive - nothing exciting happens, and it is impossible to try new strategies in new battles, cause the same exact thing happens in all battles. You ask you capital ship to fire a volley of rockets at an enemy ship. The enemy ship explodes. You wait five seconds and repeat....

Do not buy this game!
